The '''Fall of Dol Guldur''' was the epic conflict that culminated the [[Rhovanion]] campaign of the [[War of the Ring]]. 

==History==
===Prelude===
In [[March]] of {{TA|3019}}, Sauron directed his armies in [[Dol Guldur]] to assail the [[Elves of L贸rien]] and the [[Woodland Realm]] as part of his northern campaign in the [[War of the Ring]]. These armies made three assaults across the [[Anduin]] against [[L贸rien]]. Although grievous harm was done to the borders of the forest, all these attacks were driven back for the valour of the [[Galadhrim]] was great and the power that lay in the woods was far too powerful to be overcome unless [[Sauron]] had come there himself.<ref name=great>{{App|Great}}</ref>

Upon the destruction of the [[One Ring]] that same day, the [[Shadow]] of [[Sauron]] was lifted from the hearts of his enemies and fear and despair fell upon his servants and allies.<ref name=great />

=== Battle===
On [[28 March]], [[Celeborn]] led the host of [[Galadhrim]] across the [[Anduin]] on many boats and took Dol Guldur.<ref>{{App|Chief}}</ref> After taking the fortress, [[Galadriel]] threw down its walls and laid bare its pits, cleansing the forest.<ref name=great />

=== Aftermath ===
On [[6 April|April 6]] Celeborn and [[Thranduil]] met in the midst of the forest and renamed it [[Eryn Lasgalen]], the "Wood of Green Leaves."  Celeborn took the land south of [[the Narrows]] for himself and named it [[East L贸rien]], while Thranduil took all the forest north of the [[Mountains of Mirkwood]]. They gave the middle of the wood to the [[Beornings]] and [[Woodmen]].<ref name=great />
